title: SRL-Assisted AFM: Generating Planar Unstructured Quadrilateral Meshes with Supervised and Reinforcement Learning-Assisted Advancing Front Method. (arXiv:2305.00540v1 [math.NA])
abstract: High-quality mesh generation is the foundation of accurate finite element analysis. Due to the vast interior vertices search space and complex initial boundaries, mesh generation for complicated domains requires substantial manual processing and has long been considered the most challenging and time-consuming bottleneck of the entire modeling and analysis process. In this paper, we present a novel computational framework named ``SRL-assisted AFM" for meshing planar geometries by combining the advancing front method with neural networks that select reference vertices and update the front boundary using ``policy networks." These deep neural networks are trained using a unique pipeline that combines supervised learning with reinforcement learning to iteratively improve mesh quality. First, we generate different initial boundaries by randomly sampling points in a square domain and connecting them sequentially. These boundaries are used for obtaining input meshes and extracting training dat

Title: SRL-Assisted AFM: Generating Planar Unstructured Quadrilateral Meshes with Supervised and Reinforcement Learning-Assisted Advancing Front Method. (arXiv:2305.00540v1 [math.NA])
Abstract: High-quality mesh generation is the foundation of accurate finite element analysis. Due to the vast interior vertices search space and complex initial boundaries, mesh generation for complicated domains requires substantial manual processing and has long been considered the most challenging and time-consuming bottleneck of the entire modeling and analysis process. In this paper, we present a novel computational framework named ``SRL-assisted AFM" for meshing planar geometries by combining the advancing front method with neural networks that select reference vertices and update the front boundary using ``policy networks." These deep neural networks are trained using a unique pipeline that combines supervised learning with reinforcement learning to iteratively improve mesh quality. First, we generate different initial boundaries by randomly sampling points in a square domain and connecting them sequentially. These boundaries are used for obtaining input meshes and extracting training dat
translated_title: SRL辅助AFM：结合监督学习和强化学习辅助推进前缘方法生成平面四边形网格
translated_abstract: 高质量的网格生成是精确有限元分析的基础。由于巨大的内部顶点搜索空间和复杂的初始边界，对于复杂的域进行网格生成需要大量手动处理，并长期被认为是整个建模和分析过程中最具挑战性和耗时的瓶颈。在本文中，我们提出了一个名为“SRL辅助AFM”的新型计算框架，通过结合前进法和选择参考点和使用“策略网络”更新前沿边界的神经网络来网格化平面几何。这些深度神经网络使用独特的管道进行训练，将监督学习与强化学习相结合，以迭代地提高网格质量。首先，我们通过在一个正方形域中随机采样点并按顺序连接它们来生成不同的初始边界。这些边界用于获取输入网格并提取训练数据。
tldr: 该论文提出了一种新型计算框架“SRL辅助AFM”，将前进法与神经网络结合，生成平面几何的四边形网格结构。该独特的管道方法将监督学习与强化学习结合，迭代地提高了网格质量。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel computational framework named "SRL-assisted AFM" for generating planar unstructured quadrilateral meshes. The advancing front method is combined with neural networks that select reference vertices and update the front boundary using "policy networks". The unique pipeline method combines supervised learning and reinforcement learning to iteratively improve mesh quality.
